22 PfmsSample::PfmsSample(ros::NodeHandle nh) : nh_(nh)
23 {
24  // Subscribing to odometry
25  sub1_ = nh_.subscribe("robot_0/odom", 1000, &PfmsSample::odomCallback, this);
26  // Subscribing to laser
27  sub2_ = nh_.subscribe("robot_0/base_scan", 10, &PfmsSample::laserCallback, this);
28  // Subscribing to occupnacy grid
29  sub3_ = nh_.subscribe("local_map/local_map", 1, &PfmsSample::occupancyGridCallback, this);
30 
31  // Publishing markers
32  viz_pub_ = nh_.advertise<visualization_msgs::MarkerArray>("visualization_marker", 3, false);
33 
34  // Below is how to get parameters from command line, on command line they need to be _param:=value
35  // For example _example:=0.1
36  // ROS will obtain the configuration from command line, or assign a default value 0.1
37  ros::NodeHandle pn("~");
38  double example;
39  pn.param<double>("example", example, 0.1);
40  ROS_INFO_STREAM("example:" << example);
41 
42  goalReceived_ = false; // We will use this atomic bool to let us know when we have new data
43 
44  // Allowing an incoming service on /face_goal
45  service_ = nh_.advertiseService("face_goal", &PfmsSample::faceGoal, this);
46 }

48 PfmsSample::~PfmsSample()
49 {
50 }

52 bool PfmsSample::faceGoal(a4_setup::RequestGoal::Request &req, a4_setup::RequestGoal::Response &res)
53 {
54 #ifdef USE_GIVEN_START_POSE
55  {
56  ROS_INFO_STREAM("start at: [x,y]=[" << req.pose_start.x << "," << req.pose_start.y << "]");
57 
58  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck_3(poseDataBuffer_.mtx);
59  poseDataBuffer_.pose.position.x = req.pose_start.x;
60  poseDataBuffer_.pose.position.y = req.pose_start.y;
61  }
62 #endif
63  // When an incoming call arrives, we can respond to it here
64  ROS_INFO_STREAM("request to: [x,y]=[" << req.pose.x << "," << req.pose.y << "]");
65 
66  // We make a copy of the pose request to share it in other threads of processing (Ex5 for instance)
67  {
68  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck(goalPoseBuffer_.mtx);
69  goalPoseBuffer_.pose.position.x = req.pose.x;
70  goalPoseBuffer_.pose.position.y = req.pose.y;
71  }
72 
73  // Let's get the Grid
74  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck(ogMapBuffer_.mtx);
75  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid = ogMapBuffer_.grid;
76 
77  // We now construct gridPorcessing, which takes a grid and internally makes a copy of the grid
78  // Which is why we unlock here immediately therafter
79  GridProcessing gridProcessing(grid);
80  lck.unlock();
81 
85  // We can transform either way (global to local) or (local to global)
86  // Here we go global to local
87  geometry_msgs::Point local;
88 
89  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck2(poseDataBuffer_.mtx);
90  geometry_msgs::Pose pose = poseDataBuffer_.pose;
91  lck2.unlock();
92 
93  local.x = (req.pose.x - pose.position.x);
94  local.y = (req.pose.y - pose.position.y);
95 
96  geometry_msgs::Point zero;
97  zero.x = 0;
98  zero.y = 0;
99 // We store the result of checking connectivity
100 // in ack field of the responce (if you look at the service message, the ack is just a boolean
101 // res.ack = gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(zero, local);
102 
103 #ifdef UPDT_CHECK_CONNECTIVITY_INPUT
104  zero.x = req.pose_start.x;
105  zero.y = req.pose_start.y;
106  local.x = req.pose.x;
107  local.y = req.pose.y;
108 #endif
109  bool result = gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(zero, local);
110  res.ack = result;
111  if (result)
112  {
113  ROS_INFO_STREAM("Goal can be reached");
114  }
115  goalReceived_ = true;
116 
117  return true; // We retrun true to indicate the service call sucseeded (your responce should indicate a value)
118 }
119 
120 // A callback for odometry
121 void PfmsSample::odomCallback(const nav_msgs::OdometryConstPtr &msg)
122 {
123 // We store a copy of the pose and lock a mutex when updating
124 #ifndef USE_GIVEN_START_POSE
125  {
126  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck(poseDataBuffer_.mtx);
127  poseDataBuffer_.pose = msg->pose.pose;
128  }
129 #endif
130 }
131 
132 void PfmsSample::occupancyGridCallback(const nav_msgs::OccupancyGridPtr &msg)
133 {
134  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck(ogMapBuffer_.mtx);
135  ogMapBuffer_.grid = *msg;
136 }

140 }
141 
142 void PfmsSample::seperateThread()
143 {
148  ros::Rate rate_limiter(1.0);
150  while (ros::ok())
151  {
156  if (goalReceived_)
157  {
158  // Let's check which way we should face
159  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck(poseDataBuffer_.mtx);
160  geometry_msgs::Pose robotPose = poseDataBuffer_.pose;
161  lck.unlock();
162 
163  // Below is how to get yaw ... if your still wondering
164  // double robotYaw = tf::getYaw(robotPose.orientation);
165 
166  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck2(goalPoseBuffer_.mtx);
167  geometry_msgs::Pose goalPose = goalPoseBuffer_.pose;
168  lck2.unlock();
169 
170 #ifdef UPDT_CHECK_CONNECTIVITY_INPUT
171  geometry_msgs::Point local;
172  local.x = goalPose.position.x;
173  local.y = goalPose.position.y;
174 
175  geometry_msgs::Point zero;
176  zero.x = robotPose.position.x;
177  zero.y = robotPose.position.y;
178 #else
179  geometry_msgs::Point local;
180  local.x = goalPose.position.x - robotPose.position.x;
181  // local.y = goalPose.position.x - robotPose.position.x;
182 
183  local.y = goalPose.position.y - robotPose.position.y;
184 
185  geometry_msgs::Point zero;
186  zero.x = 0;
187  zero.y = 0;
188 #endif
189  // Let's get the Grid
190  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lck3(ogMapBuffer_.mtx);
191  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid = ogMapBuffer_.grid;
192  GridProcessing gridProcessing(grid);
193  lck3.unlock();
194 
195  // Why would a goal reachability change?
196  // It could have been in uknown space first and then free OR
197  // It could have been behind a wall and your robot now has line of sight to it!
198  bool reachable = gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(zero, local);
199  // ROS_INFO("local point %f %f", local.x, local.y);
200 
201  // Let's send a marker with color (green for reachable, red for now)
202  std_msgs::ColorRGBA color;
203  color.a = 0.5; // a is alpha - transparency 0.5 is 50%;
204  // the colors r,g,b are floats 0 - 1.
205 
206  if (reachable)
207  {
208  // ROS_INFO_STREAM("Goal can be reached");
209  color.r = 0;
210  color.g = 1.0;
211  color.b = 0;
212  }
213  else
214  {
215  // ROS_INFO_STREAM("Goal CAN NOT be reached");
216  color.r = 1.0;
217  color.g = 0;
218  color.b = 0;
219  }
220 
221  // Let's also publish the marker here
222  visualization_msgs::MarkerArray marker_array = produceMarkerArray(goalPose, color);
223  viz_pub_.publish(marker_array);
224  }
225 
226  rate_limiter.sleep();
227  }
228 }
229 
230 visualization_msgs::MarkerArray PfmsSample::produceMarkerArray(geometry_msgs::Pose pose, std_msgs::ColorRGBA color)
231 {
232  visualization_msgs::MarkerArray marker_array;
233 
234  int marker_counter = 0;
235  visualization_msgs::Marker marker;
236 
237  // We need to set the frame
238  // Set the frame ID and time stamp.
239  // marker.header.frame_id = "/world"; // this is wrong reference frame
240  marker.header.frame_id = "/local_map/local_map"; // fixed
241  // single_marker_person.header.stamp = ros::Time();
242  marker.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
243 
244  // We set lifetime (it will dissapear in this many seconds)
245  marker.lifetime = ros::Duration(2.0);
246  // Set the namespace and id for this marker. This serves to create a unique ID
247  // Any marker sent with the same namespace and id will overwrite the old one
248  marker.ns = "test";
249  marker.id = marker_counter++;
250 
251  // The marker type, we use a cylinder in this example
252  marker.type = visualization_msgs::Marker::CYLINDER;
253 
254  // Set the marker action. Options are ADD and DELETE (we ADD it to the screen)
255  marker.action = visualization_msgs::Marker::ADD;
256 
257  marker.pose.position.x = pose.position.x;
258  marker.pose.position.y = pose.position.y;
259  marker.pose.position.z = 0.0;
260 
261  // Orientation, we are not going to orientate it
262  marker.pose.orientation.x = 0.0;
263  marker.pose.orientation.y = 0.0;
264  marker.pose.orientation.z = 0.0;
265  marker.pose.orientation.w = 1.0;
266 
267  // Set the scale of the marker -- 0.5x0.5x0.5 here means 0.5m side
268  marker.scale.x = 0.5;
269  marker.scale.y = 0.5;
270  marker.scale.z = 0.5;
271 
272  // Alpha is stransparency (50% transparent)
273  marker.color = color;
274 
275  // We push the marker back on our array of markers
276  marker_array.markers.push_back(marker);
277 
278  return marker_array;
279 }
